featured.text: Some regions prepare horses made of cucumbers and cows made of eggplants, hoping that the spirits will come back to Earth quickly, on a horse, and leave slowly, riding the cow.
All passengers riding in cars are required to fasten their seatbelts in order to reduce the risk of _____ in case of an accident.
With rising oil prices, there is an increasing _____ for people to ride bicycles to work.

other.text: You may experience the discomfort from the motion of cars, boats, or amusement park rides.
Completely wheelchair-accessible, the park features 25 acres of attractions including rides, playgrounds, a catch-and-release fishing lake, and picnic areas throughout the park.
The new expansion is composed of five themed splash pads and a River Boat Adventure Ride.
The rides are custom- designed to accommodate wheelchair riders so that every family member can enjoy the fun.
You can also take medicine before your ride to avoid or reduce nausea and vomiting.
I can give you a ride.
In the five years since his heart transplant, he had been on an exercise program where he regularly rode a bicycle for five miles, swam each day, and walked a couple of miles.
The adapted rides include the Off-Road Adventure, where guests can test their driving skills in sporty vehicles.
He demanded that his kidnappers play tiring games with him, such as riding Bill as a horse for nine miles.

definition.zh_def: 騎乘，搭乘（交通工具）或乘坐（遊樂設施）。
definition.en_def: To sit on and control the movement of a vehicle, animal, or amusement ride.
definition.example: I love to ride my bicycle in the park.
